setvalues S3 class — s3-setvalues
text: Functions specifying creating objects class "setvalues" input values field set(). also 3 child classes, "finite", "interval" "sequence".

title: setvalues S3 class — s3-setvalues
text: values numeric Vector values representing finite set numeric Lower bound interval. numeric Upper bound interval. sequence_function function function one argument (representing previous value) constructing sequence. initial_value function Initial value sequence.

title: setvalues S3 class — s3-setvalues
text: following three types set values available: setvalues_finite() finite sets example:  {0,1}{0, 1}{0,1} setvalues_interval() continuous intervals real domain, example:  [0,8)[0,\infty)[0,8) setvalues_sequences() sequences countably infinite cardinality, defined recurrence relations :  +1=f()withinitialvaluea0a_{n+1} = f(a_n) \text{\:\:initial\:value\:} a_0an+1=f()withinitialvaluea0 example:  Ncanbeconstructedwithf(x)=x+1anda0=0\mathbb N \text{\:can\:\:constructed\:\:} f(x) = x + 1 \text{\:\:} a_0 = 0Ncanbeconstructedwithf(x)=x+1anda0=0 Note: exhaustive sufficient purposes package (.e. simple sets represent support allowable paramter values distribution).
